summary: This bill, the Strategic Homeland Intelligence and Enforcement Legislation to Defend Against the CCP Act (SHIELD Against CCP Act), mandates the Department of Homeland Security to establish a working group focused on countering threats posed to the United States by the Chinese Communist Party. This includes threats related to terrorism, cybersecurity, border and port security, and transportation security. The bill outlines the structure, duties (including examining, assessing, and reporting on DHS efforts), and reporting requirements of the working group. It also calls for annual assessments, research and development, and a review by the Comptroller General, with a sunset clause after seven years.
